Trustworthy AI systems

Artificial Intelligence systems trust assessment present unique challenges.

The specification

Data-based artificial intelligence applications sole specification is on a fixed subset of data. There is however no guarantee that the application will behave accordingly on real-world, online data.

Defining precisely how the program should behave under which circumstances requires expressive power.

The system

As Artificial Intelligence is becoming pervasive in real-world applications, the complexity of systems using AI increases. AI programs are now components of wider systems with multiple interactions.

Assessing the reliability of components of a system while taking into account their environment is a crucial next step for trustworthy AI.

The verification

Machine learning programs tend to be hard to verify. Their huge amount of variables, coupled with non-linear behaviours require a dedicated toolbelt.

A vast array of techniques exist to assess that a program behaves accordingly to its specification. From guided testing to formal verification, those techniques can be tailored to suit in a specific safety assessment process.

A Platform for Characterizing Artificial Intelligence Safety and Robustness

Publications

Here are the papers involving CAISAR

CAISAR: A platform for Characterizing Artificial Intelligence Safety and Robustness

Abstract

We present CAISAR, an open-source platform under active development for the characterization of AI systems’ robustness and safety. CAISAR provides a unified entry point for defining verification problems by using WhyML, the mature and expressive language of the Why3 verification platform. Moreover, CAISAR orchestrates and composes state-of-the-art machine learning verification tools which, individually, are not able to efficiently handle all problems but, collectively, can cover a growing number of properties. Our aim is to assist, on the one hand, the V&V process by reducing the burden of choosing the methodology tailored to a given verification problem, and on the other hand the tools developers by factorizing useful features-visualization, report generation, property description-in one platform. CAISAR will soon be available at https://git.frama-c.com/pub/caisar.
